titleStmt.title: An antidote against antinomianisme. The first dosis. The unjustifiablenesse of justification before faith. Prescribed and administred in a soft answer: I. To seven arguments. II. To the solutions of five objections. III. To the novell distinction of Gods reconciliation to man, without mans reconciliation to God. Penned plainly, for the undeceiving of the plain-hearted Christian; and mildely, for the regaining of our mistaken brother H.D. By D.H.
titleStmt.author: D. H.

notesStmt.note: A reply to "Seven arguments to prove, that in order of working God doth justifie his elect, before they doe actually beleeve" and "Grace, mercy, and peace" by Henry Denne.
Title page verso reprints the title page of Denne's "Seven arguments ..".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
